JobFullDesc: Quality Manager, Franchise Xbox Studios Quality is looking for a passionate, systems thinking, experienced individual to lead and manage the Quality Team for a franchise within the Xbox Game Studios portfolio.  You’re a people first, long term thinker, who strives to drive improvements into the people, processes, and technologies for your team, organization, and studio partners.  You’ll be leading the effort to empower your teams to improve efficiency and better prevent, measure, detect, and communicate problems across a franchise, both in well-established titles and exciting new ventures.  Simultaneously you’ll be driving the quality perspective with our Xbox Game Studios partners, making key decisions that weave together information across the franchise, impacting our player experiences from design, process workflows, development processes, marketing, services, community teams, deployment and support.  This will leverage your strong communication and strategic thinking skills. Your core responsibility will be helping grow and empower your project teams through owning and iterating on quality strategies across the franchise, helping to enable and shape the direction of each of the project teams, composed of multiple disciplines, including Quality Analysts, Quality Engineers, Quality Leads, Software Engineers, and Data Scientists.  As our products and release schedules increase exponentially in complexity, you’ll look for opportunities to employ new/existing processes, technologies, and advanced data techniques across titles, striving to create a sustainable and scalable framework for the teams to operate in, all with the goal of creating the best product for our players. Being part of Studios Quality creates a huge opportunity to level up across all of Xbox Game Studios.  You will work with other Quality Managers to share learnings and insights from both success and failure as well as establish long-term strategies for the Quality organization.  Through this collaboration you’ll work to improve processes, technology, and techniques across all of the titles we support. #gamingjobsResponsibilitiesManage, lead, and grow an inclusive organization of diverse individuals through recruiting, coaching, and teachingDrive the holistic Quality efforts for a franchise with multiple projects being developed in worldwide locationsLeverage technology – tools, automation, advanced data techniques – to increase productivity and team member impactEvolve and further a data first, customer obsessed, quality culture both with the Quality team and with key partner teamsDevelop sustainable and scalable testing strategies that are focused on the long termFoster strong partnerships across disciplines and organizational boundaries, including studio engineering, production, art, design, community, operations, and business developmentManage, improve on, and promote cross team projects and work directed at fulfilling the long-term vision and goals of the Xbox Studios OrganizationBe a key member of the Studios Quality Leadership team, working to drive improvements in processes and technology across the entire
